abstract: Nebraska is preparing for its Big Ten inauguration game against Wisconsin, whose fans traditionally leap up and down in unison to the song Jump Around between the third and fourth quarters; marketing employee Kevin Kluender is credited with starting the tradition at Camp Randall Stadium in 1998.
snippet: No college stadium rocks more than Wisconsin’s Camp Randall, thanks to a tradition that started in 1998 when a marketing employee played the song “Jump Around.”
lead_paragraph: No college stadium rocks more than Wisconsin’s Camp Randall, thanks to a tradition that started in 1998 when a marketing employee played the song “Jump Around.”

headline.main: With Nebraska in Town, Madison Gets Ready to Jump
headline.seo: With Nebraska in Town, Wisconsin Gets Ready to Jump
